definition: dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to build by laying bricks or stones

sentences.english: Perhaps Percy Fawcett was in the right place but looking for the wrong thing: stone cities.
sentences.chinese: 佛西特也許找對了地方，但眼光卻錯放在石砌城市上。

sentences.english: This bridge is made of thousands of stones, some of which weigh as much as several tons.
sentences.chinese: 這座大橋時用數千塊石砌成的，有些石頭重達數噸。

sentences.english: The fountain was comprised of three stone basins.
sentences.chinese: 那個噴泉由三個石砌水池組成。

sentences.english: The surface integral low mounds, burial stone city bone.
sentences.chinese: 浮土積卑丘，葬石砌城骨。

sentences.english: The private road was just a narrow ribbon, its stony surface covered with grass and weeds.
sentences.chinese: 這條私人道路像條狹窄的帶子，石砌路面長滿野草。

sentences.english: Every day, through the stony streets the tumbrils, nor jolted heavily, filled with condemned.
sentences.chinese: 每天，塞滿了罪犯的囚車沉重顛簸地走過石砌街道。

definition: to build a structure out of layered bricks or stones
to build by laying bricks or stones
courtyard/atrium/opening in a roof/skylight/caisson ceiling/(TCM) acupuncture point TB10
road or pavement laid with flagstones
winding corridor/cloister/ambulatory (covered walkway around a cloister)
